2023.title: Avionics Intern @ SpaceX
2023.blurb: I'm working at SpaceX again for the summer. I'm returning to the same team in Los Angeles and I'm super excited to be back!

2023.title: Embedded Dev @ Smartex.ai
2023.blurb: I worked on the amazing embedded software team, helping to modernize and digitize the textile industry. There I developed the world's first system to accurately track production of fabric in metres using cameras.

2023.title: Living in Portugal!
2023.blurb: My internship at Smartex was in Porto, so I got to skip out on Canadian winter! I loved the city, the language, and hanging out with the people I met there. Smartex is an incredible company with amazing people.

2022.title: Study Exchange in Madrid
2022.blurb: After spending a year learning Spanish, I finally got the chance to live in Spain! I met people from all over the world and got to study in an amazing environment.

2022.title: Deep Learning Dev @ ABR
2022.blurb: A machine learning and data science coop! Although I've done quite a few personal projects in this area, being able to learn from experts and play with bleeding-edge models was an incredible experience.

2022.title: PM @ UW Blueprint
2022.blurb: I was the technical lead for half of this ten month project, leading a team of 6 devs to create a course platform for an Alberta-based NPO. I was then the PM for the other half, leading the designers and handoff.

2021.title: Avionics Intern @ SpaceX
2021.blurb: I got the chance to work at SpaceX! I was a sensor development intern for Starship Avionics, developing precise data pipelines, demodulation algorithms, and data fitting methods.

2021.title: Summer in Los Angeles!
2021.blurb: My SpaceX internship was in person, so I lived in LA for the summer! I surfed, rock climbed, bungee jumped, and got to make incredible friends that I will cherish forever.

2021.title: CUTC Technology Lead
2021.blurb: As a part of the Canadian Undergraduate Technology Conference I lead the technology team, which provides the infrastructure to allow the conference to function. We primarily focused on registration, the website, and the blog.

2021.title: FPGA AI Processor
2021.blurb: I designed and implemented a verilog design that performed neural network inferences. It runs on a FPGA simulation and can run any binarized neural network. This project was a dive into Verilog and AI optimization.

2020.title: Firmware Security @ AMD
2020.blurb: I developed communication systems inside new APUs while maintaining security and efficiency. Although is was completely remote, I'm still very thankful because I got to work with incredibly smart people.

2020.title: Passion Finding App
2020.blurb: I made this app to help people explore concepts and ideas in a non-linear way. Users can explore a 2D map of interests and see how they see themselves in it. This took lots of data analysis, app design, and development!

2020.title: AI Acceleration Engineering @ Untether AI
2020.blurb: My first tech job ever! I worked in Toronto for both the Hardware and Software teams; I helped build their SoC verification suite and the drivers that transfered data to and from their chip!

2020.title: Vibeify: An AI DJ
2020.blurb: At QHacks2020 we built a website that tracks the 'vibe' of a room (using motion data) and plays music accordingly.

2019.title: Started University at Waterloo!
2019.blurb: I began my first term in September! I met amazing people, played Varsity Ultimate Frisbee, and lived on my own for the first real time.

2019.title: Camp Counselour
2019.blurb: I worked at Camp Couchiching after being a camper there for 10 years. I got to spend lots of time with some really amazing kids.

2019.title: Shad at UCalgary
2019.blurb: In July I went to Calgary and worked with an amazing group, developing a product focused on environmental sustainability. I got to play a lot of Ultimate Frisbee, visit some tourist destinations, and camp! I even got to be the Valedictorian :)

2019.title: Four bit Computer
2019.blurb: I spent six months breadboarding, designing, and building a fully programmable four bit computer - it was the most intense hardware project I've built. The final product is a printed circuit board with a 3D-printed case a laser-cut acryllic cover.

2019.title: Student Theatre Festival
2019.blurb: I organized and hosted a student-run threatre festival with plays, a magician, musical acts, and improv. I have also wrote a play and directed, acted, and ran audio for the entire show. This is my favourite memory from highschool.

2019.title: Flexible PCB Snake Game
2019.blurb: I designed & soldered a custom SMT PCB with an LED matrix and a solar panel. As an added challenge, the entire game was programmed in Assembly (600+ lines)
